Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Copper-containing bactericides provide partial disease control. Apply at first sign of disease and repeat at 10- to 14-day intervals when warm, moist conditions prevail
Tomato___Early_blight: While there is no cure for blight on plants Once blight is positively identified, act quickly to prevent it from spreading. Remove all affected leaves and burn them or place them in the garbage

Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Applying fungicides when symptoms first appear can reduce the spread of the leaf mold fungus significantly
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Removing infected leaves and spray organic fungicide
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Mix Pure Neem Oil with Coco-Wet and apply every 3-5 days to kill pest eggs indoors and interrupt the reproductive cycle

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Sanitation is the most important application to practice when controlling tobacco mosaic virus.Destroy any seedlings that appear stunted or distorted and then decontaminate tools and hands.
